intro: Grimmeodendron eglandulosum, commonly known as the smoothleaf grimmeodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with four petals. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
